required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Vascular Disease, Inflammation and Hormones in Women With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This study planned to learn more about women and how the drop in estradiol levels during menopause may affect their cardiovascular risk. With aging, the arteries that are located around the heart get stiffer, and this increase in arterial stiffness can lead to a number of health problems such as high blood pressure and heart disease. In this study, the investigators examined whether a short-term drop in estrogen levels caused arteries to become stiffer, and explored potential reasons for stiffening arteries.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants completed two study visits. The baseline study visit occurred during the early follicular phase of the menstrual cycle, confirmed via take-home ovulation testing. On the day of the baseline study visit, all participants underwent ovarian sex hormone suppression with GnRHant therapy (cetrorelix acetate, 0.25 mg/day) delivered daily as subcutaneous injections for a 1-week period. Participants were randomized to one of two concurrent intervention groups: transdermal estradiol patch (0.075 mg/day) (+E2) or placebo patch (+PL) and returned for a follow-up visit after 1 week of the intervention. Both study visits included collection of anthropometric measures, a fasting blood sample, measures of arterial stiffness, flow-mediated dilation, and endothelial cells via an intravenous catheter.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants were randomized to either receiving a gonadotropin-releasing antagonist (GnRHant) with estradiol add-back (+E2) or placebo (+PL). Investigators and participants were blinded to randomization status until the study was completed.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: FMD will be measured following an intravenous saline infusion and ascorbic acid infusion.
FMD will be measured following an intravenous saline infusion and ascorbic acid infusion.
FMD will be measured following an intravenous saline infusion and ascorbic acid infusion at baseline and follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative immunuofluorescence of endothelial cell proteins at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Expression of estrogen receptor alpha, estrogen receptor beta, endothelial nitric oxide synthase, and phosphorylated endothelial nitric oxide synthase in endothelial cells

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative immunuofluorescence of endothelial cell proteins at follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Expression of estrogen receptor alpha, estrogen receptor beta, endothelial nitric oxide synthase, and phosphorylated endothelial nitric oxide synthase in endothelial cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in quantitative immunuofluorescence of endothelial cell proteins
primary_outcome.description: Expression of estrogen receptor alpha, estrogen receptor beta, endothelial nitric oxide synthase, and phosphorylated endothelial nitric oxide synthase in endothelial cells

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm received GnRHant and a transdermal estradiol patch (0.075 mg/day) for a period of 1 week.
Participants in this arm received GnRHant and a placebo patch for a period of 1 week.

intervention.description: All participants self-administered GnRHant daily between the baseline and follow-up visits (cetrorelix acetate, 0.25 mg/day).

intervention.intervention_name: Estradiol Patch, 0.025 Mg/24 Hours Weekly Transdermal Film, Extended Release

intervention.description: Placebo patch designed to match active Climara patches.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Premenopausal
- Euthyroid
- Not currently planning to become pregnant
- Not currently breastfeeding
- No recent history of amenorrhea in the previous 6 months
- Consent to data and specimen banking
- No use of hormonal contraceptives
Inclusion Criteria, type 1 diabetes only:
- Diagnosis of type 1 diabetes for at least 5 years
- On insulin within a year of diagnosis
- Current insulin therapy
- Hemoglobin A1c < 9.5%
- No macroalbuminuria (AER < 200 ug/min)
Inclusion Criteria, non-diabetic controls only:
- Hemoglobin A1c < 5.7%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and/or breastfeeding
- Have not had a menstrual cycle in the last 6 months
